document.docAuthor: Pereira, Alan Deivid, Bazilio, Sergio & Orsi, Mário Luís
document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of medium-sized to large mammals of Campos Gerais National Park, Paraná, Brazil

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Checklist of medium-sized to large mammals of Campos Gerais National Park, Paraná, Brazil

figureCitation.captionText: Figures 2–7. Photographs of the medium-sized and large mammal species recorded in the Parque Nacional dos Campos Gerais, state of Paraná, Brazil.2. Didelphis albiventris. 3. Didelphis aurita. 4. Myrmecophaga tridactyla. 5. Tamandua tetradactyla. 6. Dasypus novemcinctus.

caption.paragraph: Table 1. List of land medium-sized and large mammal species at the Parque Nacional dos Campos Gerais, Brazil. Record method; Footprint (F), Visualization (VI), Camera traps (CT), Vocalization (VO). Conservation status by (IUCN), Brazilian List of Threatened Species (BR), Paraná state List of Threatened Species (PR). Data Deficient (DD), Endangered (EN), Least Concern (LC), Not evaluated (NE), Near Threatened (NT), Vulnerable (VU) and Critically Endangered (CR). Species added in 2016 to 2017 (+). Exotic species (*). Small species (**).

Figure 31 . The rarefaction curve (observed and estimates by jackknife 1) of mammal species registered by identification of footprints and trap cameras. Vertical bars represent standard deviation. CT: Camera trap; F: footprints.

subSubSection.paragraph: Records. Record was in May 01, 2014 camera trap 1 ( 25°02.25ʹ S , 050°01.39ʹ W ).

Identification.
Euphractus sexcinctus
has 6 to 8 moving
bands on the back of the carapace; there are 2 to 4 orifices in the region of the pelvic girdle near the base of the tail.
